review.comments:
I will not be able to express enough how wonderful staying here is!! I am not one who generally stays in hotels like Iebua State Tower and they made me feel just as special as all the rest of their customers. They knew my name everywhere I went and were beyond helpful with everything I needed. 
My room was phenomenal with incredible views from the 58th floor. The breakfast was perfect as it was ala carte but you could order as much as you wanted. Sitting poolside and with the lovely breeze every morning, it was a perfect place to start your day. Also, communicating on LINE was very helpful with the little questions or planning for the housekeepers to come in or a planned taxi that was needed.
If you want to treat yourself to a fantastic place to stay...Iebua at State Tower is a must stay!!

review.comments: I’m returning customer. This place is amzing. Best hotel service. highly recommend!

review.name: Adam
review.comments:
And here’s where it cuts. The suite was dated and lacked the facilities I expect from an hotel of this class - no modern conveniences (USB charging, functional WiFi, functional coffee) but I wonder if that was because we were a lower floor, superior suite. Having stayed at the Marina Bay Sands (my bar now for these establishments) Lebua State Tower drew short. 
But hey, it was £90 a night so what do we expect...
Well, yes, that would be fair until you try to experience the Skybar. As residents we were still shuttled into the holding pen of Distil with the walk-in trade, and there was no option to skip the queue (as in MBS). For an iconic venue where people literally stay in the establishment for that caveat... I was a bit irritated by this. You buy a (grotesquely priced) cocktail and once finished you are ushered into the skybar (but only photos in certain spots please...). Walk in trade; fine I get that. It costs a lot to maintain an iconic venue and you can’t lose out to opportunist selfie hunters, but your guests have already funnelled several hundred pounds into your tills... we’d appreciate a little understanding for that. 
But the markets the market. Lebua clearly aim their lower tier suites at basic travellers seeking a status symbol check in for a short stay. I raise my hand - I am that basic bitch. But at the same time, I could have halved my bill and stayed in the Marriott down the road. Instead I chose an iconic venue and feel a little taken-advantage-of. 
If Lebua don’t want riffraff like me than upgrade your rooms, triple your rates to Shangri-La levels, and charge me B1000 to come up the lift and take a photo on the terrace.

review.name: Emily
review.comments: The restaurants are so overpriced! When we arrived we were starving after a long flight. Nipped to the pool area for quick bite to eat. Ended up sharing a simple margarita pizza that was £20 and shared a small £5 bottle of water. We were horrified. Safe to say we didn’t eat anywhere in the hotel again. The rooftop bar is even worse. £60 for a basic and I mean basic gin and tonic and one cocktail. We stayed for one and then left. We were also told we couldn’t take pictures until we had been to the bar so don’t expect to just go up to enjoy the view and leave again, even as a hotel guest. The soundproofing between the rooms is terrible. We had a couple next to us arguing into the early hours of the morning and then let’s just say we heard them make up again. The rooms themselves are pretty basic for a 5 star hotel. No frills. The bathroom is large but quite dated especially the shower.

review.name: Tarryn
review.comments:
There´s a certain cagey-ness to visiting the onsite restaurants. Very disappointing in fact. 
When you arrive you are given a beautiful map and brochure advertising the various bars & restaurants on site. However - try find a menu and pricing - it´s nigh impossible. So we followed dress code rules etc, which is no problem at all and asked to go for a drink at the famed Sky Bar on one evening of our stay.
We were whisked up to the top floor, only to then be dropped two floors down and taken to their Pink Champagne Bar - where we were led to a table & pressed repeatedly to stay and enjoy the view there. We said over & over no thanks & left the Pink Bar asking again to be taken to the Sky bar. So we go up again, and then are led YET again into another bar - this time the Whisky bar. Again NOT where we wanted to be. At this point we had a menu shoved in our face and we were told that ONLY if we order a drink at this bar we could go to the Sky Bar. WHAT?
So we left - disgruntled to say the least. Before going back down, I managed to enter Scirocco and the Sky Bar area - but after having been shoved and pushed around - where the aim was definitely to force you to order OVER priced drinks at numerous bars before giving you what you want - we decided against eating at their restaurant the next night and left feeling rather disgusted at the service. 
We were paying to be in the hotel - we were not riff raff off the street. 
The sneakiness of also not allowing guests to see the menu before making a reservation at the restaurants (for which you must also pay a deposit - even if you are already a hotel guest who has ALREADY paid a deposit on check in of 10,000 Baht) - is also rude. I struggle to understand why they would not publish their menus and pricing - would they rather embarrass their guests when they realise that dinner may cost more than they realise? 
I have been to many Chefs Table and fine dining restaurants - & never been treated this way.

review.name: Fiona
review.comments:
The ridiculously inflated prices in the bars and restaurants... eg. £100 a bottle for an Italian Sauvignon! That’s without the extra 10% service and 7% service charge.
We were hotel residents and visited the sky bar and they took us to the other bars on the way trying to get us to buy drinks in the pink bar, in the whiskey bar, we had to be really firm in the end to go to the top, which spoiled it a bit

Shukumvit area is too crowded and less attractive than other parts of Bangkok, but its sky bar should be a must on your list.

review.name: Georgie

Our room was amazing, we was on the 29th floor, we had an amazing view from our bedroom and bathroom. The rooftop bar was a great feature, the drinks were great and the view was top draw. The infinity pool is also nice for relaxing. All the staff are so attentive and helpful, the concierge recommended a water market which was a great day out!

review.name: Ahmed_ae
review.comments: The carpet of the room was with old yellowish and black stains that can not be removed even the sides of the bed, and the worst thing ever that I didn't like is that I deposit 5,000 Baht safety deposit for 7 nights, then after the 3rd day they asked for another 5,000 Baht safety deposit just because of my laundry bill reached around 9,000 Baht but it never happened to me something like that beside I always stay in this hotel when visiting Bangkok, every hotels I stayed in never did that because what happened in novotel it's like pay in advance not safety deposit and I asked them to show me the policy with article number but they never did, they showed me check in paper that I signed it and it has nothing to do with what happened, the hotel acted cheap it's like I'm going to run away or check out without paying them. And I asked them for the second time why is the extra deposit ! They said it's just to guarantee their money... Would you imagine ! And another staff spoke to me on the phone said that I have to deposit 5,000 at least to accept my laundry otherwise they will not accept my cloths to be washed ! Wow ! ... In the end the manager came to my room and apologized to what happened he said the hotel was not clear about this thing and he just started to work in this hotel it's been around 3 months and the reason why he came because I requested him. By the way the laundry bill reached approximately 18,000 Baht when I checked out and it's been paid without any problems, but this time what happened during my stay was weird, strange... Ah let's not forget, the TV is not smart and small + the shower of the bathroom has to be covered by curtain to prevent water spreading.

Executive Lounge team and the VIP Check-In team are not friendly as the team at the normal reception counter. They were not attentive and did not converse while doing the arrival nor were welcoming when we proceeded to the Executive Lounge for refreshments or snack.

But then wanted my credit card to take a nominal payment to prove my identity, this was annoying as we had pre-paid. They were concerned that we would request a refund through booking after we left. It made us feel like criminals. Check in was more focused on money and processes rather than making you feel welcome. I had pre contacted about a late check out and on arrival they could only extend to maximum of 1pm, I offered to pay more but not possible !! annoying as we had a late flight. Also the walk from the BST was quite long through the mall with rucksacks. When you get to the hotel they call a bell boy to carry the last bit to your room. Would have paid to have bell boy met you at entrance to mall. When we left we got a taxi to aiport for 500 baht much easier.

review.name: Mitchel
review.comments:
They require full payment in advance upon checkin + 2000 per day deposit. So if you're staying 1 week, you're paying fully in advance and then also having a 14,000 baht hold on your credit card. I think thats a ridiculous policy, given that it can take 3 weeks for that money to release on your card. I tried to discuss it with the front office manager but I found her to be a rude arrogant woman. I explained all other 5 star hotels I've been too don't operate this way. I tried to ask for the hotel manager, she tried to claim she's the hotel manager. Not so, since I met the hotel manager a few days earlier (a foreigner).
The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night across the entire hotel. So the lobby was full of people. That's where I met the hotel manager mentioned above as he came in from home. He said it's a malfunction and I noticed they had to kill the system for a day or two as the red light wasn't flashing on the smoke detector.
They have a silly policy of not allowing grab or foodpanda riders to simply ride up to the front of the hotel to deliver food. Security force them to go around the back of the hotel through boom gates, get a parking card, and all this rubbish. Completely unnecessary and confusing for the riders and the guests.
They claim the restaurant is open 24 hours for room service. In actual fact the restaurant closes at 9pm and if you order food after 9pm you can only choose from the "night menu" which has about 5 things on it. No Thai food whatsoever. Only Burgers, pasta, that type of stuff. The stuff an assistant can heat in the microwave.

review.name: Masaki
review.comments:
Doorman was kinda rude, looks uncomfortable to serve. doorman didnt greet from the first meeting at the taxi getting off, didnt bring my baggage off from taxi, and did not bring up to the table in the room, mean he did not ask where is good to put the baggage even he came in to the room inside in this corona situation, so why he needs to come in to that room in corona situation.Even just going through the entrance was the time to see he shows uncomfortable to open the door for me. But all other door was closed. So I did not go out anywhere after once I saw it. the other girl stuff also made face of telling wifi password after check out to call grab, and did not answer "You are welcome" nor anything after I said "Thank you". 5 star? Really?
 Pool was needed to precook so not flexible.
No corona partition at lobby and full of people speaking anywhere.

review.comments: Marble floors in room

review.name: Martin
review.comments:
Just a couple of things that disappointed me firstly the room service one of the meals made me sick the calamari tasted like it had some cleaning product on it I also asked for some sauce and they forgot. This was disappointing as when I reported this to reception they just said sorry they didn’t even take off the bill. 
The second was they tried to over bill me in the cooling tower I also wanted to reserve the table with the best view as was my birthday and had friends coming and even though I was a guest they gave booking to outside party who were not staying in the hotel this is quite disappointing for a hotel being 5 stars as guests should always be given priority. 
This was added too a disappointment as they could not even get us a table in the Cantonese restaurant even though we asked two days prior.

review.name: Malisa
review.comments: The service for breakfast wasn't really good. Maybe I was there at 9:40am almost closing time. The toasts came out first with no utensils until I had to ask for them. Not a big problem but I expect to have that part of a service mind. The scrambled eggs came out cold though. The Cesar salad dressing was way too sour. You may be asking well I did finish the food, yes because I was hungry. One of the waiters serving water spilled some water on my table without apologising and rushing away. Anyways breakfast this time is not so good - the quality and the service. On Saturday night, I honestly expected a lot for the cooling tower. Unfortunately the location of the seats are just ridiculous especially a long sofa in which it should be facing the view outside not inside facing other guests. Didn't like the mojito ordered - i should have told the bartender but it's ok not a big deal. The staff was good though - very attentive thank you!

review.comments:
Staff were very welcoming, accommodated my request for a high room for my boyfriends birthday (although the birthday cake in the room offered did not happen).
The room was spacious and the bathroom was fantastic with a wonderful shower. 
The pool had a great view and lots of offers on drinks at different times. The rooftop bar was what made me choose the hotel and it didn’t disappoint! 
The breakfast as other reviews said was amazing with so many continental and Asian options.

review.name: Pat
review.comments: Most everything about this places was of very high quality. Our one night stay was prepaid so we were taken aback on arrival by the demand for a credit card deposit of 1000 TB - something about a mini bar guarantee. We felt like clients at the service counter of a low-cost car hire company rather than at the desk of a four star hotel. We protested and after some time the people on the desk relented. We had similar feelings when we asked for a late checkout. This was kindly granted at half the rate of a full booking. We were ok with that arrangment. When I noted the half day rate I was quoted was more than than half what we had paid for the room we were told that the hotel was using the rate for the day. But when I (immediately) compared this rate to Booking.com rate for the day I was surprised to learn the rate quoted was actually higher that the Booking.com rate. We decided to leave things be.

review.name: Vanessa
review.comments: This hotel was gorgeous! A classy upscale gem in a crazy city. The rooftop bar had an amazing sunset view with great drinks. The lobby was spacious, luxurious with delicious breakfast. The infinity pool was a bonus and much needed after days of walking.

review.comments: It's a very good hotel, although I would say that there's not a great deal to do within walking distance of the hotel. There is the free shuttle over to IconSiam which is the most incredible shopping centre, with great value food on the lower floor. The water taxis are easily accessible and good value to get to the Royal Palace. Do not overlook the happy hour (think it was 6-8pm) and other options which make a drink decent value. Also the breakfast is a really good option and by sheer volume alone will keep you going all day and work out cheaper than anywhere nearby. I'd definitely recommend the hotel to others.

review.name: Lauramcnamara
review.comments:
The location is fab, the water taxi has a stop right behind the hotel and takes you all over the city. Super convenient for visits to Grand Palace, Temple of Emerald Bhudda, Wat Arun, Khaosan Road and more. 
Breakfast is fantastic, the buffet is huge but make sure you're there before closing. On our first day we went down a bit later than normal due to being tired from traveling and by the time we'd sat down with an omelette they were clearing away so when they say breakfast ends at 10/1030, they really mean it. If you like to have a few breakfast rounds, I'd say leave an hour! 
The gym is great, we used it quite late in the evenings and it was empty (joys of jetlag). For a hotel gym it is very well equipped with a number of different resistance machines as well as mix of weights and a Smith machine. We didn't use the pool but it looked nice. 
We ate in Thara Thong one night and it was delicious but MEGA expensive. We'd only just arrived in Thailand as this was our first stop and had we been out and about we probably would have realised how expensive it was in comparison to out and about but the service was great, the restaurant has a lovely authentic feel to it that we didn't get anywhere else.

review.name: Kenny
review.comments:
Super Spacious lobby. Smells great. Well equipped facilities. Business center/M lounge was great as we were treated to desserts and drinks until late daily. I was there daily from 8pm to 1030pm to reply my mails and never once I felt uncomfortable. Lighting was good and the place was very conducive for work meetings. 
Food wise - it was crazy at the goji. Make sure you set aside about an hour or more for breakfast because the spread is just crazy good. 
Location - situated just about 10 mins from the BTS station and beside a park. Bring a pair of shoe along to have a run in the morning. Loads of runners. It was super Easy to get around as the BTS is well connected. Convenience stores are just outside the hotel so you can get food at anytime of the day. Food is also readily available around the area. 
The whole stay was extremely pleasant except for one issue with the shower door which had water leaking to the bathroom floor. I travelled with my kids this and I felt unsafe for them to be walking on wet floors. 
I highlighted to the staff and they came very very promptly and tried to fix the problem. I told them we are going out soon and they said they will reply us ASAP and do something about it. 
When we returned to the hotel, we spoke to the duty manager, Rachel, who explained to us that the rubber seal was not good for the bathroom door and was extremely apologetic that we had to switch rooms that night itself. She was so apologetic that she gave us a mini upgrade to the toilet with a smaller bathtub and also gifted the family complimentary breakfast at the goji. *this is a compliment to the Rachel and team for trying to solve the problem ASAP without inconveniencing us. 
Thank you Marriott for ensuring we had a very good stay.

2. We got to our room and the blinds wouldnt work. Not great.
3. There is a beautiful rooftop bar but the staff there were rude to us. They ignored us when we came in so we sat ourselves on a table.. no menu for 10 minutes so I had to get up and ask for one myself. When we finally ordered drinks the waitress was fairly dismissive and inpolite. We were really disappointed
4. Dont expect to feel special at this hotel. It is huge and not personable. I really do recommend the JW Marriott Bangkok instead of the Marriott Marquis.

I let him know that I was. He then passed my door without opening it as he had intended to do in the first place but then noticed that I am black and decided to skip it. Don't worry, I called him back to open the door. They also sent the cleaner to my room while I was getting ready to leave to ask me if I was checking out. I didn't understand why. When I said something to the front desk girl about it she raised her voice at me, pretty much the ultimate in rudeness in Thai culture. I would say customer service is hit or miss. Cleanliness could have been better as well. There was a stain that looked like blood on the floor and cabinet of the bathroom in the first room they put me in and a white creamy stain appeared on the door while I was showering in the second.

Besides, there are ants in washroom and I don’t know where the ants came from.

The check-out staff also were not wearing masks, despite having to speak toguests from all around the world every day.
On check-in the staff didn't give any information, for example you need to use your room card to activate the lift.

There is only one thing I want to ask the favor to adjust, the television. There is no netflix or other entertainment applications except youtube on the tv, and I can't install it on tv by myself. I think it would be great if we could spend time with our lover or friends by watching some movies in the hotel room because we can't do other activities like going to the pool, the club or shopping due to COVID-19. (The reason why i don't answer this paragraph on the dislike topic is because it doesn't like I dislike it at all. I enjoyed watching YouTube, but if there had been more choices, there would have been better.)

review.comments: Nothing

review.name: Kim
review.comments:
We originally wanted to stay only 2 days but due to the Corono crisis we had to stay longer and extended our stay to 6 nights.
The Hotel is very nice and directly located at a Metro Station and two big malls.
The staff is very nice and helpfull. Nice, modern and clean rooms. Cool Pool and Fitnessstudio.
The breakfast should get 11 from 10 points!!

review.name: Stephen
review.comments: The chairs around pool are metallic so heat up in direct sun

review.name: Thawanrat
review.comments:
Next to MRT station only 1 min walk
Near Supermarket 
Cheap prices 
Clean
Nice view

review.name: Damian
review.comments: Great hotel! Comfy, modern and clean. Stuff is very polite and helpful. We had breakfast included in price and it was great decision. Food was tasty with large variety of different meals (including western style). Metro station is around 2 minutes walk from the facility. It is a great point for sighting the Bangkok.

review.name: Darryn
review.comments: Nothing at all...

review.name: Maciej
review.comments: Very good standard hotel. Vast breakfast choices with good coffee. The pool was nice for a one day relax. Close to metro and some shopping malls.

review.name: Agata
review.comments: We really liked the hotel and it's location (metro station is right next to the hotel). Rooms are very clean with nice city views, comfortable beds. Very good breakfasts. Big swimming pool on 6th floor.

review.name: Denise
review.comments: Nothing

review.name: Tanawan
review.comments: the hotel walls are not sound professional. You can hear guests in adjoining rooms - next door as well above .

review.name: Joyce
review.comments: The room was good, the bed very comfy, breakfast was good and the pool was for our stay also good. Nice gym where they have everything you need for a nice workout. A 7eleven directly next the hotel and a very good massage salon just a step outside the hotel. For our stay of 3 days a good hotel.

review.name: Kuan
review.comments: Absolutely nothing!

review.name: Geert
review.comments:
The bedroom doors are made from cardboard so you can hear everything what is happening in the hallway.
The floor in the hallway is made from the wrong material so you can hear every footstep and shoe from passing people.

review.name: Mervyn
review.comments: The only problem I can see is that the entrance to the carpark is narrow/awkward, so you will scratch the Bugatti..... but the Mazda just fits

review.name: Sglenday
review.comments: The sun lounges are made of metal so get hot during the day.

review.name: Darryn
review.comments: Getting more expensive each time we book

review.name: William
review.comments: Nothing

review.name: Blaz
review.comments:
Amazing hospitality from stepping into the hotel untill the check out. Staff always with smile on their faces and hotel itself is great. Comfortable and big rooms, pool and gym are amazin and breakfast with wide range of European and Asian food. They storaged our bags after the check out for the whole day. Massage in a room was fantastic too. 
Will be definitely returning!

review.name: Felix
review.comments: The fitness and pool are so professional! The front office staff are friendly and helpful. The room is fully equipped. Recommend!

review.name: Ann
review.comments: The Wi-fi was a bit weak.

review.name: Aimee
review.comments: the staffs explanation of the payment/deposit scheme was confusing and i wasn't the only one very confused at the desk!

review.name: Eric
review.comments: Great stay in Bangkok for a family. Excellent breakfast, restaurant, fitness center and pool. Right next to the metro stop which was very convenient.

review.name: Bernd
review.comments: Nothing was negativ

review.name: S7eepyhead
review.comments: Very Comfortable and good location

review.name: Ana
review.comments: Room wae clean and spacious, with a nice view. Breakfast was great - with lots of food varieties, also for the children. The swimming pool was nice, too. There is also a fitness room.

review.name: Ani
review.comments: Water of swimming pool is too cold

review.name: Anton
review.comments: Overall the hotel exceeded my expectations. The WiFi was a bit slow at times but it was stable enough to get work done.

review.name: Alex
review.comments: Our only beef was that were a bit thin. One morning we heard someone’s alarm go off for about five minutes (who lets their alarm go for that long??). Another time we heard some guy coughing his lungs up.

review.name: Gary
review.comments:
This time I stayed longer and decided to upgrade room and upgrade to breakfast.
Reading the reviews I think a lot of people have bad taste or there not English as the breakfast is the worst I’ve had and the restrict machine so you carnt have latte or capachino, you have to pay even extra for this 80 baht and it’s rubbish.
Breakfast waste of money - cheaper and better outside.
Also when they clean rooms they leave door open and many moskito fly in room so after not knowing this, 2 days later my face was like a balloon with moskito bites, I might as well of slept on the street.
I had to pay money at pharmacy to get treated for moskito bites because of room and still go out to get a descent capoachino.
Won’t be staying here again and I’ve stayed here around 10 times in 2 years.
I will post a picture of my face after 2 nights in staying in these rooms.
